span.span: Please click here to see this important information.

span.style: font-size: 18px;

p.span: Information from the Eastern Illinois Foodbank:

blockquote.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

span.style: font-size: 13px;
font-size: 13px;
font-size: 13px;
font-size: 13px;

br.br: For more information you can visit their website by clicking here

span.style: color: rgb(255, 0, 0);

br.span: There will be a food distribution at the First Church of Christ on Thursday April 16, from 4:00 - 6:00 PM. The Georgetown Friends Church has canceled its food pantry for April.

br.br:
The next breakfast and lunch distribution for Georgetown-Ridge Farm schools will be on Wednesday, April 22 from 1:00 - 3:30 PM at Georgetown-Ridge Farm High School.
Don't forget to friend us on Facebook. Several grade level teams have created Facebook pages to help communicate with parents as well.
Click on these links to see updates from the district about the current health crisis.
Daily Memo 4-23-2020
Daily Memo 4-22-2020
Daily Memo 4-21-2020
Daily Memo 4-20-2020
Social Distancing Information
Covid 19 Information
E-Learning Plan

span.style: font-size: 24px;

hr.p:
Georgetown-Ridge Farm Unit #4 is located in east-central Illinois. The district is comprised of 3 campuses: Georgetown-Ridge Farm High School (500 West Mulberry), which includes grades 9-12; Mary Miller Junior High School (414 West West Street), which includes grades 6-8; and Pine Crest Elementary School (505 Kennedy Drive) which serves Kindergarten - 5th grade. The district office and Early Childhood programs are located in the Georgetown-Ridge Farm High School. The district office mailing address is (502 West Mulberry).
Community members from both Georgetown and Ridge Farm play an active role in creating an excellent learning environment for our students.We are proud of the administration, faculty, staff, students, parents, and community members who make up our school community. Welcome to our home page. We hope you enjoy learning about our school district.

span.a: Bad apps your student should never use

span.style: font-size: small; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
line-height: 25px; font-family: Arial; font-size: 13px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
span.br:
The Parent Portal is now available for parents to connect with the progress of their student. To obtain a parent/guardian login to InformationNOW, please contact your student's school. Users must receive a username and password. Click on the quick link to the right to go to the website once you have received your information.
This Quick Reference Guide provides an overview of the options available through a parent/guardian login to InformationNOW. Depending on how a student’s school utilizes InformationNOW, some of the options may not be available.
